message_1:
What is the heat of combustion of methane gas (CH4) at standard conditions, given the following data from the combustion of carbon (C), hydrogen (H2), and methane (CH4)?

C(s) + O2(g) -> CO2(g)      ΔH⦵rxn = -393.5 kJ/mol
H2(g) + 1/2O2(g) -> H2O(l)  ΔH⦵rxn = -285.8 kJ/mol
CH4(g) + 2O2(g) -> CO2(g) + 2H2O(l)  ΔH⦵rxn = -890.4 kJ/mol

Assume all reactants and products are at standard conditions (25°C and 1 atm).
message_2:
The heat of combustion of methane gas (CH₄) at standard conditions is already given in the problem statement:

CH₄(g) + 2O₂(g) -> CO₂(g) + 2H₂O(l)  ΔH⦵rxn = -890.4 kJ/mol

So, the heat of combustion of methane gas (CH₄) at standard conditions is -890.4 kJ/mol.
